ground_truth.expected_language: Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information to the extent required by applicable law, regulation, or legal process, provided that the Receiving Party (to the extent legally permitted) gives the Disclosing Party prompt written notice of such requirement prior to disclosure to enable the Disclosing Party to seek a protective order.

ground_truth.redline_text: 7.1 Non-Competition. The Receiving Party shall not compete with the Disclosing Party or provide services to any competitor for a period of two (2) years following termination of this Agreement.

ground_truth.original_text: shall not exceed the greater of (a) the fees paid under this Agreement, or (b) One Million Dollars ($1,000,000)
ground_truth.applicable_rule: Limitation of Liability - Unlimited Exposure Flag

ground_truth.redline_text: 9.3 Audit Rights. The Disclosing Party may audit the Receiving Party's premises, systems, and records at any time without prior notice to verify compliance with this Agreement.
ground_truth.expected_language: 9.3 Audit Rights. The Disclosing Party may audit the Receiving Party's premises, systems, and records at any time without prior notice to verify compliance with this Agreement.

ground_truth.applicable_rule: Term and Survival - Excessive Duration Amendment
ground_truth.expected_language: three (3) years following the termination or expiration of this Agreement

ground_truth.original_text: Neither party may assign this Agreement without prior written consent of the other party
ground_truth.redline_text: The Disclosing Party may assign this Agreement at its sole discretion without consent. The Receiving Party may not assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party
ground_truth.expected_language: Neither party may assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
